name: Rosemary
description: Salvia rosmarinus (formerly Rosmarinus officinalis), commonly known as rosemary, is a woody, perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the mint family Lamiaceae and has been used since ancient times as a culinary herb, medicinal plant, and in perfumery. The plant is rich in antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds, including rosmarinic acid and carnosic acid. Rosemary has been associated with memory enhancement, and historically symbolized remembrance and fidelity.
